channel.title: PSU wattage
channel.description:
This is my setup:
i5 2500 ASUS P8H67 M Evo WD Black Caviar 1TB GSKILL Ripjaws 1333
Eventually I'll buy a graphics card, don't know which one right now.
The two options of PSU I can get are these:
Cooler Master Silent Pro 600W (Modular) U$S 172
Cooler Master Silent Pro 700W (Modular) U$S 198
I've already read reviews and these seem to be solid PSUs.
The question is: will 600 watts be enough, or do I NEED 700 watts?
EDIT: Obviously I won't overclock

item.title: PSU wattage
item.dc:creator: Luciel
item.description:
With the new 2nd gen cpus and modern ram, power usage has decreased a lot so I would say, as the others have said, that unless you plan to run SLI or the top end GPU, 600 should be more than enough, you just have to decided if you want normal or modular.

Read full topic

item.title: PSU wattage
item.dc:creator: King_Kaddo
item.description:
600W would be enough even for a GTX580

Read full topic

item.title: PSU wattage
item.dc:creator: Dec
item.description:
You will only need 700W for the best graphics cards out there, but I am guessing you will buy a budget card, so 600W should be more than enough.

Read full topic
